times crown shaping rnd1 slm c2f p1 k3 p2 c2b c2f p2 c6f c6b p2 c2b c2f p2 k3 p1 c2b 3 times rnd2 and every even round slm knit the knits purl the purls rnd3 slm c2f k2tog k2 p2tog c2b c2f p2tog k4 ssk k2tog k4 p2tog c2b c2f p2tog k2 ssk c2b 3 times you should have 96 sts on needles rnd5 slm k1 k2tog k2 p1 c2b c2f p1 k3 ssk k2tog k3 p1 c2b c2f p1 k2 ssk k1 3 times you should have 84 sts on needles rnd7 slm k2tog k2 p1 ssk k2tog p1 k2 ssk k2tog k2 p1 ssk k2tog p1 k2 ssk 3 times you should have 60 sts on needles rnd9 slm k2tog k1 p1 ssk p1 k1 ssk k2tog k1 p1 ssk p1 k1 ssk 3 times you should have 42 sts on needles rnd11 slm k2tog p1 p2tog ssk k2tog p2tog p1 ssk 3 times you should have 24 sts on needles rnd13 rm k1 p2tog k2tog 5 times p2tog k2tog knit together the last and the first st of the round so the first st is knitted twice you should have 12 sts on needles cut the yarn leaving 6 tail thread it through the remaining sts pull them to close the crown finishing weave in all ends on the left side of the hat block to fit you may add a pom pom on the top many many thanks to my wonderful pattern testers enyo
